verses.verse: In that time period, Herod, the head of one-fourth of the region, heard the hearsay about Jesus.
And he said to his servant boys, "This is John the Submerger. He was gotten up from the dead, and because of this, the abilities are active in him."
You see, when Herod took John into custody, he tied him up and put him in jail because of Herodias (the wife of Philip, his brother);
for John was saying to him, "It is not permitted for you to be having her."
And wanting to kill him, he feared the crowd because they had him as a preacher.
As Herod's birthday celebrations were conducted, Herodias' daughter danced in the middle of them, and it satisfied Herod.
From this, with an oath, he acknowledged to give her whatever she asked for.
The daughter, who was forced forward by her mother, declares, "Give me here on a plate, the head of John the Submerger."
And the king was sad. But because of the oaths and the people reclining together with him, he gave the order for it to be given.
And after sending someone, he beheaded John in the jail.
And his head was carried on a plate and given to the girl. And she carried it to her mother.
And when his students came forward, they took the body away and buried it. And when they came, they reported it to Jesus.
And when Jesus heard it, He took a back way from there in a boat to an uninhabited place by Himself. And when the crowds heard, they followed Him on foot out of the cities.
And when Jesus came out of the boat, He saw a big crowd, had sympathy on them, and healed their sick.

When it became evening, His students came to Him, saying, "The place is uninhabited, and the hour already passed by. Dismiss the crowds so that after going away into the villages, they might buy food for themselves."
But Jesus said to them, "They have no need to go away. You give them something to eat."
The students say to Him, "We don't have anything here except five loaves of bread and two fish."
Jesus said, "Bring them to Me here."

And after He gave the order for the crowds to recline on the grasses and took the five loaves of bread and the two fish, when He looked up into the sky, He conferred prosperity on them. And after He tore them, He gave the pieces of bread to the students, the students to the crowds.
And everyone ate and was full. And they picked up what was left over of the torn pieces, twelve full baskets.
The people eating were as if they were five thousand men, besides women and young children.
And right away Jesus urged His students to climb on board into the boat and to be going ahead of Him to the other side until the time that He will dismiss the crowds.
And after dismissing the crowds, He climbed up into the mountain by Himself to pray. When it became evening, He was there alone.
The boat already in the middle of the sea was being tortured by the swells. You see, the wind was opposing them.
In the fourth guard shift of the night (3:00 to 6:00 a. m.), Jesus went off toward them traipsing around on the sea.
When the students saw Him traipsing around on the sea, they were uneasy, saying, "It is a ghost," and they yelled from the fear.
Right away Jesus spoke to them, saying, "Be courageous. It is Me. Don't be afraid."
When Peter responded to Him, he said, "Master, if it is You, give the order for me to come toward You on the water."
Jesus said, "Come." And after Peter climbed down out of the boat, he traipsed around on the water to go toward Jesus.
But seeing the strong wind, he was afraid, and after he began to be dropped down, he yelled, saying, "Master, rescue me."
Right away when Jesus put out His hand, He latched on to him and says to him, "Seldom trusting Peter, why did you doubt?"
And when they climbed on board into the boat, the wind died down.
When the people in the boat came, they bowed down to Him, saying, "You truly are a son of God."
And when they crossed all the way over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.
And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent out into all of that surrounding rural area, and they brought to Him all the people who had it bad.
And they were encouraging Him so that they might just touch the fringe of His robe. And as many as touched were completely rescued.
